details:
Secunia reports:

> phpLDAPadmin have some vulnerabilities, which can be exploited by
> malicious users to conduct script insertion attacks and by
> malicious people to conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
>
> 1) Some input isn't properly sanitised before being returned to
> the user. This can be exploited to execute arbitrary HTML and
> script code in a user's browser session in context of an affected
> site.
>
> 2) Input passed to the "Container DN", "Machine Name", and "UID
> Number" parameters in "template\_engine.php" isn't properly
> sanitised before being used. This can be exploited to inject
> arbitrary HTML and script code, which will be executed in a user's
> browser session in context of an affected site when the malicious
> user data is viewed.
summary: phpldapadmin -- Cross-Site Scripting and Script Insertion vulnerabilities
